NO.

D.C. Code § 28-3851 et seq. 
 Amended By D.C. Law 23-98, § 2, 67 DCR 3923, eff. 6/17/2020 (Security Breach Protection Amendment Act Of 2020).
Explicit Private Right of Action?: NO. D.C. Code § 28-3853(a) was repealed by the 2020 Amendment. However, a violation of this statute, or any rule issued pursuant to the authority of this statute, is considered an unfair or deceptive trade practice. D.C. Code § 28-3853(b).

9 Guam Code Ann. § 48.10 et seq.
Explicit Private Right of Action?: No, the attorney general has exclusive authority to bring action. 9 Guam Code Ann. § 48.50.

Neb. Rev. Stat. § 87-801 et seq., “Financial Data Protection and Consumer Notification of Data Security Breach Act of 2006.”
Nev. Rev. Stat. § 603A.010 et seq.
Explicit Private Right of Action?: Data collector that provides requisite notice may bring suit for damages against a person that unlawfully obtained or benefited from personal information obtained from records maintained by the data collector. Nev. Rev. Stat. § 603A.900.

Citation:
N.H. Rev. Stat. § 359-C:19 et seq., “New Hampshire Right to Privacy Act.”
 For the insurance industry: N.H. Rev. Stat. § 420-P:1 et seq., “Insurance Data Security Law.”

N.M. Stat. Ann. §57-12C-1 et seq.

N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law § 899-aa (applicable to non-governmental entities); N.Y. State Tech. § 208 (applicable to governmental entities); N.Y. Educ. Law § 2-D (applicable to educational agencies and their third-party contractors).
Explicit Private Right of Action?: No, but the state AG may sue on behalf of citizens and obtain damages for them, including consequential financial loss for failure to notify (in addition to imposing civil fines). N.Y. Gen. Bus. Law § 899-aa(6)(a)(as applicable to non-governmental entities). No applicable provision for governmental entities. No applicable provision for educational agencies and their third-party contractors.

Citation: N.C. Gen. Stat. § 75-61 et seq. “Identity Theft Protection Act”, N.C. Gen. Stat. § 75-65.
Explicit Private Right of Action?: YES, but only if an individual is injured as a result of a violation of this section. N.C. Gen. Stat. § 75-65(i).
